labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to manage Twitter account interactions programmatically. It provides tools to retrieve tweets, post content, delete tweets, and manage user timelines, allowing users to automate and streamline their Twitter activities. The server facilitates direct Twitter API interactions, which can be integrated into applications for enhanced Twitter management.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of the server revolves around Twitter account management, making "Social Media" the most appropriate label. Secondary functionalities include automating interactions, aligning with "Browser Automation" for web interactions, and API-based operations fitting under "API Integration". No custom label is needed as predefined categories cover the server's features adequately.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Twitter MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @LuniaKunal/mcp-twitter
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage your Twitter account programmatically with powerful features like retrieving timelines, fetching user tweets, searching hashtags, sending direct messages, and creating or deleting posts. Automate and streamline your Twitter interactions efficiently through this server. Enhance your Twitter experience by integrating these capabilities into your applications.

tools.name: get_tweets
tools.description: Deploy Server Twitter MCP Server @LuniaKunal/mcp-twitter Try in Playground

tools.name: get_user_tweets
tools.description: Get tweets from a specific user's timeline.

tools.name: get_replies_for_tweet
tools.description: Get Tweets replies of a specific tweet using tweet_id.

tools.name: post_tweet
tools.description: Post a tweet with optional media, reply, and tags.

tools.name: delete_tweet
tools.description: Delete a tweet by its ID.

tools.name: get_timeline
tools.description: Get tweets from your home timeline (For You).

tools.name: get_latest_timeline
tools.description: Get tweets from your home timeline (Following).

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@LuniaKunal/mcp-twitter/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
